conclusion: Break down the problem into motion in magnetic field and electric field.
Particle starts from origin O with initial velocity v0 at 45 degrees to y-axis.
Initial velocity components are v0x = v0/sqrt(2) and v0y = v0/sqrt(2).
In a magnetic field, the particle moves in a circle with radius R.
Centripetal force equation qvB = mv^2/R gives R = mv/qB.
Radius R for initial velocity v0 is R = mv0/qB.
Particle makes half a circle to reach point Q.
Period T of circular motion is T = 2πm/qB.
Time to move from O to Q is t1 = πm/qB.
Velocity at Q is v0 and horizontal due to magnetic deflection.
Electric field directed along negative y-axis causes constant acceleration a = qE/m.
Horizontal component of velocity remains v0.
Horizontal distance from Q to P is 3L, time required is t2 = 3L/v0.
Vertical displacement must match L, solving gives E = 2mv0^2/9q.
Total time t_total = t1 + t2 = πm/qB + 3L/v0.
